reviewText: LEGENDS OF COMEDY from Reader's Digest is a 3 VHS tape series available in a sturdy gloss-coated storage case or as individual programs. Each runs a little under an hour, has HiFi audio and is of fine quality. Narration provides only general information about what's on screen. The second edition of this series, Great Stars of Film and Radio - The Fabulous 40's features those who appeared on radio during its Golden Age. Most radio clips have accompanying film footage. Except for a complete version of a Spike Jones song, all film samples are fairly brief. PROGRAM-- 1.) EDGAR BERGEN - Radio broadcast film features Charlie McCarthy in uniform, plus Mortimer Snerd / W.C. Fields photos / Charlie gets honorary degree 2.) MAE WEST - Clips from "The Heat's On" (1943) with Victor Moore / With Charlie McCarthy on radio 3.) 3 STOOGES - Bio with Ted Healy, plus segments of "Disorder in the Court" (1936), "Sing a Song of Six Pants" (1947), "Malice in the Palace" (1949) and other shorts 4.) MARX BROS. - Rare photos / Reenactment of "I'll Say She Is" (1925) skit / Chico and Harpo playing / Groucho in "A Day at the Races" (1937), "Room Service" (1938) and "Horse Feathers" (1932) / Stateroom scene from "A Night at the Opera" (1935) 5.) VICTOR BORGE - Tchaikovsky's 2nd Piano Concerto routine 6.) DANNY KAYE - Film of patter song from Armed Forces radio show 7.) SPIKE JONES - TV show parodies of "Song of the Volga Boatmen" and "Cocktails for Two" (complete) 8.) BOB HOPE - Screen debut in "Going Spanish" (1934) / "My Favorite Brunette" (1947) / USO radio broadcasts with Lana Turner, Judy Garland, Frances Langford, Jerry Colonna, Bing Crosby / With JFK / In Vietnam with Johnny Bench 9.) ABBOTT & COSTELLO - "Colgate Comedy Hour" excerpts / "Africa Screams" (1949) / Radio film of "Who's On First" 10.) JIMMY DURANTE - "Colgate Comedy Hour": "Start Off Each Day With a Song" / "Palooka"(1934): "Inka Dinka Doo" / With Eddie Jackson: "Jimmy the Well-Dressed Man" / "Mrs. Calabash" closing LEGENDS OF COMEDY, Vol. 3 is subtitled TV Comedy Classics of the 50's & 60's
